title: Skillbanc AI Tutor
alt: AI Tutor Interface showing adaptive learning pipeline
description: An adaptive learning pipeline for students with personalized recommendations and real-time feedback, leveraging machine learning to optimize learning paths.
shortDescription: AI-powered adaptive learning system with personalized recommendations

content.text: Built on Python and Flutter, this project enhanced student retention and learning outcomes through adaptive learning strategies.
Project Overview

The Skillbanc AI Tutor is a sophisticated learning system that leverages machine learning algorithms to create personalized learning experiences. By analyzing user interactions, performance metrics, and learning patterns, the system adapts content delivery to match each student's unique needs.
Key Features

items: Personalized learning paths based on individual progress

content.text: Technical Implementation

The system employs a Python backend with machine learning models built using TensorFlow and scikit-learn. The frontend is developed with Flutter to ensure cross-platform compatibility. The recommendation engine uses collaborative filtering and content-based approaches to suggest optimal learning resources.

content.alt: System architecture diagram for AI Tutor
content.caption: High-level architecture of the Skillbanc AI Tutor system

content.text: Outcomes and Impact

Implementation of the AI Tutor led to a 27% improvement in student retention rates and a 35% increase in concept mastery compared to traditional learning methods. The system has been successfully deployed for over 1,000 students with consistently positive feedback.

related_projects: Machine Learning and Sovereign Credit Ratings

title: Smart Helmet Prototype
alt: Smart helmet prototype with sensors for athletic performance monitoring
description: Developed a wearable device to monitor and visualize athletic performance, specifically focusing on boxing punch analysis and impact detection for enhanced safety.
shortDescription: Wearable device for athletic performance monitoring and safety

content.text: Sensor integration and BLE were leveraged for real-time metrics, providing enhanced safety data during training.
Project Overview

The Smart Helmet Prototype is a wearable device designed for combat sports athletes, particularly boxers. It integrates multiple sensors to monitor impact force, head acceleration, and movement patterns, providing valuable data to enhance both performance and safety.
Key Features

items: Safety alert system for dangerous impacts

content.text: Technical Implementation

The helmet incorporates accelerometers, gyroscopes, and pressure sensors connected to a microcontroller that processes and transmits data via BLE. The companion mobile application receives, analyzes, and visualizes this data in real-time, providing immediate feedback to athletes and coaches.

content.alt: Components of the smart helmet system
content.caption: Key components of the Smart Helmet prototype

content.text: Outcomes and Impact

Testing with amateur boxers showed a 40% improvement in punch technique through data-driven feedback. The concussion risk assessment feature has been praised by sports medicine professionals for its potential to reduce training-related injuries.

title: Machine Learning and Sovereign Credit Ratings
alt: Data visualization showing credit rating predictions
description: Using machine learning models to forecast credit ratings, integrating economic and political factors to influence financial decisions and improve prediction accuracy.
shortDescription: ML forecasting system for sovereign credit ratings

content.text: Enhanced global credit rating predictions by integrating long-term financial data with machine learning techniques.
Project Overview

This research project applies advanced machine learning techniques to predict sovereign credit ratings. By analyzing historical economic data, political stability metrics, and existing rating patterns, the model provides more accurate forecasts than traditional methods.
Key Features

items: Political stability assessment using NLP on news sources
Ensemble learning approach combining multiple models

content.text: Technical Implementation

The project utilized Python with scikit-learn and TensorFlow for model development. Feature engineering extracted relevant indicators from World Bank and IMF datasets. An ensemble of gradient boosting, random forest, and deep learning models was created to improve prediction robustness.

content.code:
# Example of the ensemble model approach
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier, GradientBoostingClassifier
from sklearn.neural_network import MLPClassifier
from sklearn.ensemble import VotingClassifier

# Create individual models
rf = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100)
gb = GradientBoostingClassifier(n_estimators=100)
nn = MLPClassifier(hidden_layer_sizes=(100, 50))

# Create voting ensemble
ensemble = VotingClassifier(
    estimators=[('rf', rf), ('gb', gb), ('nn', nn)],
    voting='soft'
)

content.text: Outcomes and Impact

The model achieved an 85% accuracy in predicting rating changes 3-6 months in advance, outperforming baseline models by 15%. The research was included in my MSc thesis at EDHEC and received recognition for its innovative approach to financial forecasting.
